attributes.action: Provide our military personnel with the equipment they desperately need.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Chief of the General Staff, General Sir Richard Dannatt (Head of the Army) and Chief of the Defence Staff, Air Chief Marshall Sir Jock Stirrup (Head of the Armed Forces) have requested that more equipment be made available to military personnel serving overseas in Afghanistan.

Our armed forces are risking their lives overseas representing our will, the least we can and should do is provide them with the resources they need to make their jobs just a little bit less difficult and dangerous.

The former Secretary of State for Defence John Hutton has said that the governments position needs to be reviewed and more troops are needed. The Archbishop of Canterbury Dr Rowan Williams has expressed “desperate concern” for the welfare of British troops in Afghanistan.

This petition requests that the Prime Minister finally accept the requests made by the two Chiefs of Staff and show some much needed support for those serving in Afghanistan and other overseas conflicts.
